name: Recordant
overview:
Recordant, Inc. develops and markets audio-capture technology that empowers organizations to improve sales and customer service by recording, analyzing, and transforming face-to-face conversations between associates and the public into actionable intelligence. It offers archival, analytics, consulting, training, assessments, capture, playback, and forensics solutions in the areas of market research, sales force optimization, compliance, training retention and reinforcement, and risk management. The company also provides personal recording devices, aggregators, desktop aggregators, handset interface devices, microphone interface devices, and USB interface devices, as well as SoundMirror, a Web-based application that ensures access to business recordings and data. Recordant, Inc. serves automotive, retail, government, hospitality, law enforcement, financial services, and higher education markets.

The company was founded in 2005 and is headquartered in Alpharetta, Georgia. On February 10, 2009, Recordant, Inc. filed a voluntary petition for liquidation under Chapter 7 in the U.S. Bankruptcy Court for the Northern District of Georgia, Atlanta.

funding_rounds.source_description: Recordant Secures $9 Million in Series B Funding
